intro: Toxocarpus ovatus, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. The plant is often found in sandy or well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and disturbed habitats.
